Package hu.klenium.tetris.util

Class PeriodicTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.klenium.tetris.util.PeriodicTask
  • public class PeriodicTask
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper around Timer/TimerTask, it can be used to schedule tasks. It uses a new thread to wait delay ms effectively, execute task, and then start the period again, untill it is stopped. PeriodicTask is not started automatically, you have to start it when needed. After starting a PeriodicTask, task will be executed for the first time after delay ms.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description

      private java.lang.Runnable task  
      private java.util.Timer timer  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PeriodicTask​(java.lang.Runnable task, int delay)
      Prepares a new PeriodicTask, which can be started later.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void reset()
      Resets the period's time, so that no matter how long had the task been last preformed, next time it will be executed again after delay ms.
      void start()
      If not running yet, starts the PeriodicTask.
      void stop()
      Stops the PeriodicTask.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PeriodicTask

        public PeriodicTask​(java.lang.Runnable task,
                    int delay)
        Prepares a new PeriodicTask, which can be started later.
        Parameters:
        task - The task that need to be executed in every periods.
        delay - The length bettween two periods, in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        If not running yet, starts the PeriodicTask. If the timer has already been started, calling start has no effect.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the PeriodicTask.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the period's time, so that no matter how long had the task been last preformed, next time it will be executed again after delay ms.
